result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Treveonta Antwan Davis-Spears

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Treveonta Antwan Davis-Spears appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Patrick Flanagan appeared by video for Treveonta Antwan Davis-Spears.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective B. Dolan.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Treveonta Antwan Davis-Spears not in court, in custody.  Attorney Patrick Flanagan in court for Treveonta Antwan Davis-Spears.  Attorney Grace M. Gall in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for State v. Lee hearing.  Counsel has been appointed for the defendant.  Case adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Treveonta Antwan Davis-Spears not in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Status Counsel. SPD has not appointed counsel. Case is adjourned. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE to the trial court for a State V. Lee Hearing.
Hearing scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Treveonta Antwan Davis-Spears not in court, in custody. Abby Rockendorf in court, appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Status of counsel in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Status conference scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed:  OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report

Defendant Treveonta Antwan Davis-Spears not in court, defendant in custody.  Edward OBrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests that this matter be set for a State V. Lee hearing or status; denied. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with:
Devontay L Jackson (co-actor)

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Treveonta Antwan Davis-Spears in court with attorney Jane Jerman.  Defendant Treveonta Antwan Davis-Spears in custody.  Sarah Mackenzie Dahdouh appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Treveonta Antwan Davis-Spears appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised that due to a lower pending matter, this case has been re-assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 08:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
